basic.description: This course will be an introduction to philosophical study of the law.  Subjects that will be discussed may include such things as the following:  what law is; positivism and 'natural law'; the nature of legal authority and the obligation to obey the law; the rule of law; adjudication and interpretation; responsibility, liability, and punishment; legal rights; democracy, liberty, and equality; economic approaches to law; critical and feminist approaches to law.  No philosophical background or training is necessary.  Evaluation is by take-home exam but a paper option will be available.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Jurisprudence
